alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 12:10AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until noon EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1207 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported several ice jams near the advisory area. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Allagash, Allagash Township, Saint Francis and Saint John. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.
